definitions.definition: To make a reply or response to.
To speak in defence against; to reply to in defence.
examples: to answer a charge or accusation

definitions.definition: To respond to a call by someone at a door or telephone, or other similar piece of equipment.
examples: Nobody answered when I knocked on the door.

definitions.definition: To suit a need or purpose satisfactorily.
To be accountable or responsible ; to make amends .
examples: The man must answer to his employer for the money entrusted to his care.
He has a lot to answer for.

definitions.definition: To file a document in response to a complaint .
To correspond to; to be in harmony with; to be in agreement with.
To be opposite, or to act in opposition.
To be or act in conformity, or by way of accommodation, correspondence, relation, or proportion; to conform; to correspond; to suit; usually with to .
To respond to satisfactorily; to meet successfully by way of explanation, argument, or justification; to refute.
To be or act in compliance with, in fulfillment or satisfaction of, as an order, obligation, or demand.
examples: He answered my claim upon him.

definitions.definition: To render account to or for.
To atone for; to be punished for.
To be or act as an equivalent to, or as adequate or sufficient for; to serve for; to repay.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To make a reply or response to.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To speak in defence against; to reply to in defence.
( ambitransitive ) To respond to a call by someone at a door or telephone, or other similar piece of equipment.
( ambitransitive ) To suit a need or purpose satisfactorily.
To be accountable or responsible ; to make amends .
( law ) To file a document in response to a complaint .
To correspond to; to be in harmony with; to be in agreement with.
To be opposite, or to act in opposition.
To be or act in conformity, or by way of accommodation, correspondence, relation, or proportion; to conform; to correspond; to suit; usually with to .
To respond to satisfactorily; to meet successfully by way of explanation, argument, or justification; to refute.
To be or act in compliance with, in fulfillment or satisfaction of, as an order, obligation, or demand.
( obsolete ) To render account to or for.
( obsolete ) To atone for; to be punished for.
( obsolete ) To be or act as an equivalent to, or as adequate or sufficient for; to serve for; to repay.
